featured_reviews.review_id: I've been going to this pharmacy for more than 15 years. I love going here, but recently, I don't know which person it is, but sometimes, she's not nice when she answers the phone. It doesn't take much to be nice to people. I don't care what you're doing, you should be nice even if it's just the start of your shift in the morning.

featured_reviews.review_id: I've been using this pharmacy for many, many years because of its convenience and location.  Customer service has steeply declined. On my last visit to fill and pick up a refill, my prescription was not initially ready, and I was asked to wait aside. After more than a half hour and making eye contact with numerous assistants and pharmacists, I went to the counter to ask how much longer. It turns out that my prescription was indeed ready, but nobody informed me. Had I not approached the counter to ask, I would likely still be waiting. I understand that this is a "high volume" pharmacy, but there's no excuse to poor communication between staff.  I'll be transferring my refills to another pharmacy.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Loblaw Pharmacy #1518.  No hygiene.
Called in to check readiness for pickup a day after my doctor prescribed. Answer - Not ready, had to wait 2 days.
Called in again the next day, answer was ready.
Walked to the pharmacy, the staff said prescription was only partially filled, I paid the full amount and I have to come back to pick up the remainder next week.
The staff are not friendly. Feels like I went to this pharmacy to get some ration.
What kind of service is this?
... two weeks later..  came picked up the remaining medication.
Saw a staff picking drug pills using her bare hands. This is not hygienic. Is this allowed by the pharmacy industry?

featured_reviews.review_id: Waited over half an hour after my scheduled appointment when there was NOBODY IN LINE. Everyone is doing their own thing, nobody is on the same page. Gentleman at the front ignored me at first and when greeted asked me to wait in front of consulting; subsequent gentleman in consulting asked us to book at the front. I stress "gentlemen" here because the women pharmacists were frantically running around seemingly organising medication and incoming pick ups. If you hate your job or had a bad day, that's fine. I don't expect you to put on a fake customer service mask, just don't be rude. All I ask is for neutral service, I just want us to have a smooth sailing interaction.

featured_reviews.review_id: Don't come to this Pharmacy. On the day I visited, the sign said pharmacy opened at 9am but they were actually not ready to serve until 9:10am. The counter was still closed at 9am. The pharmacist was chatting with another pharmacist about other things while serving me. At the time picked up the prescription, the pharmacist was rushed and did not explain about the details about the prescription or any side effect. She just read the brief instructions on the medicine and did not even ask if I have any questions with the medication. They did not care about customer service. I would say avoid this pharmacy if you could.

featured_reviews.review_id: I am a regular customer.  I was very satisfied with the pharmacy's services here.  But yesterday, I feel the pharmacy need some improvement on the services.  During the Covid,  lot of Doctors won't see their patients in person anymore.  Like me, I see my family doctor by phone.  The doctor would fax the prescription to the pharmacy.  However the fax machine is down.  The on duty pharmacist refuse accept the e-mail prescription as an alternative option.  What is the difference between the fax and email?  Why the on duty pharmacist only accept the fax one.  I think this is stupid.  Hope the pharmacy can be more flexible (or at least has an alternative option for the prescription), especially now-a-day most younger people don't even know what Is a fax.  Just want the pharmacy have a better services.  I will give you a better review next time.

featured_reviews.review_id: Dropped off my prescription at 5pm today and was told that it will be ready in 1 hour, so I leave and come back at 6:30pm because I know their estimate is never right. I go up to the counter to pick up my medication and they tell me to wait on the side for 5 minutes and pointed towards the "medication information" corner. I wait in the medication information corner for about 40 minutes while they process 10 other people who received and paid for medications. The person who initially told me to wait for 5 minutes left to go for her break and did not tell anyone about my prescription. I went to line up again for the prescription pickup line and they just took it from the counter and gave it to me. I don't understand why the person who went for their break did not just process my prescription when it was already ready and on the counter.

featured_reviews.review_id: I don't want to be rude and I don't usually like to leave negative reviews but this place is very... Challenging, I'll say. I haven't had much of a problem at the counter or with wait times, but the first few times I filled a prescription they kept forgetting or failing to bill my extended benefits. Annoying but not awful. My biggest challenge is refills. The phone number currently printed on the bottles is incorrect. The phone number listed on Google is also wrong. Even the automated system you get when you call Superstore sends you to the wrong number. I had to get someone at the customer service desk to tell me the number, hang up, and redial it directly. I picked this pharmacy because I recently moved nearby and I usually get my groceries at Superstore, so this seemed like an easy decision. How could it be less convenient than driving 25 minutes across town to my old pharmacy near my old apartment? Superstore accepted my challenge and exceeded my expectations.

featured_reviews.review_id: Un caring about the health of those filling prescriptions here, and not sure how capable the pharmacist is if they don't know what they're providing.  Refused to put items through insurance claiming they did not have a prescription. This was parts of a larger order and when asked, from the Dr. Providing the prescription, they indicated it was obvious the patient had enough information on the original prescription to process such a request and that they never heard of itemizing a prescription in this manner.  Wanted to send a vulnerable individual to walk in clinics to wait with other sick people for hours when pharmacies can prescribe themselves for clear low level issues such as this.  Also filled the rest of the prescription with other drugs know and clearly indicated to treat same issue.  Either, they do not give any care to the overall health of a person, or they don't know what they're prescribed drugs do.  Went somewhere else and was able to easily get this corrected.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I have same prescription for over 3 years and there was no single time without an issue when I came to pick it up.
The worst customer service I ever experienced especially from the older lady with long gray hair. She was very rude and unprofessional. One time she gave me my usual prescription in a half size smaller box and charging me full price. I tried to explain her that this is not correct and she wasn't even able to listen to me. I went home garbed my old box with my old receipt and went back to prove it. She wasn't there and someone else who helped me found out that second half of my prescription was forgotten to give me. If she was able to listen this would never happen.
Most common issue I have when I come to pick it up, it is not ready even though I gave them few extra days. When I come they act like I have ever placed the order and they don't have it in record and they have to order something and start over. If it happened once, OK but it happens every time for over 3 years. How is that even possible?
When I told her what had happen to me last time, he kept saying NO, like she could change what already happened and is not able to listen at all.
Yes people have bad days but I think she hates her job and her life.
I am changing the pharmacy because this service is not going  to change.
If her boss was her customer she would be fired in a minute.
There are overall issues with the logistics of the pharmacy but her attitude is makes everything even worst.

featured_reviews.review_id: Worst pharmacy service I've ever received. After sitting there chatting for 20 minutes while I waited in their view, 3 of them, I was finally served by an arrogant condescending man who treated me like I was in the wrong for finally saying excuse me. I could hear what you're talking about, it was not work related, sir. However, my attendance to your location is, do your job! He then proceeded to give me vague answers and sigh repeatedly as I asked the difference between medications so I could choose one to purchase. The judgemental arrogant attitude I received, coupled with the fact he told me I couldn't get my inhaler filled until the next day (it was only 4pm) even tho I told him I was short of breath and it's just ventolin that I ALREADY HAVE A REFILL ON FILE FOR, leads me to give them a 1/10. featured_reviews.review_id:
I usually receive exceptional service here.
It was severely understaffed, which I understand but a new pharmacist (no name-tag, has a very squeaky voice) had no idea what she was doing.

I waited 1 hour and 50 minutes to pickup a prescription that was already filled out and available for pickup. She said she was unable to find it and asked me to come back in 15-20 minutes. When I returned, she said she wasn't able to find it and would search more thoroughly. I'm not the type of person to complain, so I was seated in the waiting room while she decided to process new patients instead of searching for my prescription. Everytime I checked in, I was just told 5 more minutes.

She didn't communicate what was happening at all. If someone is waiting almost 2 hours then I don't understand how
that's acceptable.
She made small talk and someone filling a job application a priority, instead of clients waiting for prescriptions.

The only thing she had to say you might as well cancel our EVO after wondering what happened. After searching again and again and THEN finally revisiting the area that holds prescriptions ready for pickup. It was there from the start!

Every other pharmacist I've seen here has been nothing short of professional, and I've never had a more negative and strange experience here.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My Mum had an incredibly disappointing experience at Loblaw Pharmacy when she went to pick up her medication. Unfortunately, it was marred by the behavior of the male pharmacist on duty, who was not only rude but also condescending. This kind of treatment is unacceptable, especially in a place that is supposed to provide care and support to customers.

My Mum, who is already dealing with health issues, should not have had to endure such disrespectful behavior from a professional who is meant to be compassionate and understanding. It left her feeling uncomfortable and hesitant to return to the pharmacy in the future.

Pharmacies should be safe spaces where people can trust the advice and assistance of the professionals working there. However, this experience at Loblaw Pharmacy shattered that sense of security and reliability. It is disheartening to see that a place that is supposed to cater to the health needs of the community fails to meet even the basic standards of customer service and respect.

I hope that this review serves as a wakeup call for Loblaw Pharmacy management to address the issue promptly. It is crucial for them to reevaluate their staff's behavior and ensure that such incidents do not happen again. No customer, especially someone seeking medical help, should be made to feel uncomfortable or unwelcome.

Given the negative experience my Mum had, I cannot recommend Loblaw Pharmacy to anyone until they address and rectify the situation. It is essential for any business to prioritize customer care, and in this regard, Loblaw Pharmacy has fallen short. As a result, I strongly advise seeking an alternative pharmacy where you can feel confident that you will be treated with respect and kindness during your visits.

featured_reviews.review_id: We shop at the North Vancouver superstore quite a bit and always get good service, however, I can't say the same about their pharmacy. If I could give them  -1 star I would, and that's why I try to avoid going to that pharmacy as much as possible.  Unfortunately, this time it was an emergency and I had to go to the nearest one asap. I was promised 40 minutes, but after 40 minutes, I was told that I have to wait another 15, then another 10 minutes. Finally after almost an hour and a half I got my medication, but at this point the pharmacist noticed that I am allergic to penicillin and the capsules I got belong to the penicillin group of medication, in spite of that she sold it to me and advised that I just take Benadryl if I feel sick. I called my doctor and explained the situation, he said that I absolutely shouldn't experiment and see if I get sick or not. He called the pharmacy and changed the prescription.  I had to wait another hour for the new prescription to be ready (of course they didn't take back the first one), but the best part was when my wife told them that their service is poor she got the answer, "then don't come here". We certainly will take their advice and NEVER shop there again.

I had to wait another hour for the new prescription to be ready (of course they didn't take back the first one), but the best part was when my wife told them that their service is poor she got the answer, "then don't come here". We certainly will take their advice and NEVER shop there again.

featured_reviews.review_id:
My family has 10+ years of experience getting prescriptions filled at this pharmacy.  In the years I been there, at least 5 or 6 different crews of people have served me, which means this pharmacy has a hard time hanging on to staff.

On more than one occasion I was dispensed the correct medication, but it was dispensed to me under the wrong Physician prescriber name!!  Even after both my physician and I pointed this out to the pharmacist manager, it happened again.

The main problem at this pharmacy is poor customer service. A lot of the problems at the North Vancouver Superstore Pharmacy can be placed squarely on the shoulders of the management team. Putting consumer needs first, need to be a key element of the workplace culture. Without good customer service, who one cares if this store can get the right pills in a container (any pharmacy can do this).

Pharmacy improvements could include: improvements to workplace culture thereby improving the satisfaction of the workers which in turn trickles down to the customers, friendliness, having Rxs ready when the pharmacy say they will be ready, fulling Rxs faxed in by physicians offices, calling customer/doctor to clarify (instead of waiting until the customer shows up) thereby forcing the customer to wait another 30 mins, calling the customer when the Prescription cant be filled.

I've moved my family to a much better pharmacy where we get much better care.

The pharmacist here goes above and beyond. Has called me to see how I was doing and asking if I was having any side effects or concerns. She always notices when I need to get a new prescription especially during this pandemic and will fax off a request if possible or tell me I need to make an appointment by phone.. She always listens and always has my best interests at heart.. highly recommend this pharmacy. Keep up the great work..
Thanks again.. Doug..

featured_reviews.review_id:
I am a senior who purchases my regular 'scrip at the south Surrey pharmacy for over 3 years.  During the COVID pandemic a wonderful young pharmacist (Lay Shah) worked really hard to work with his customers ensuring that they have accurate and appropriate information.  When I needed various vaccines over the past 3 years, he ensured that I was informed, understood all of the effects of the same.   What totally and forever impressed me and created a 'super fan' was a couple of weeks ago.  Lay was the only person (bearing in mind that he is a pharmacist) accepting drop-off and pickup orders.  I didn't have the time to wait so continued on my shopping journey.  As I was leaving the store, Lay asked if I needed to renew a 'scrip' I said yes, he asked how many meds I needed, I said all 4 and off he want to prepare my monthly order.  Didn't ask my name, no hassle, he just knew what needed to be done.  When I picked up my order today (post December 31st, he understood that I needed the scrip renewal in the last fiscal year, which was reflected.

In my opinion Lay goes the extra mile, knows his customers, their needs and is always respectful, always helpful , and always responsive.  Employee of the Year Award, if there is one, is 'owned' by Lay.  Many thanks for all of your hard work, dedication, for being there when lots of people haven't been.

All the very best to you Lay and your family.  I wish each of you a happy, safe and healthy New Year.

Warm regards from my family to yours.

featured_reviews.review_id: The pharmacist (L.S) who has assisted me several times over the past couple of years has been extremely helpful. He took time out of what I would think is a very busy schedule to educate me about the importance of some vaccinations I required.  He once contacted me at home regarding followup about symptoms I experienced after a vaccination.  He is very knowledgeable and always professional.  A credit to his profession.  I would recommend him to anyone.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I like this store in my neighborhood, especially the small cafe inside. The store is spacious and well organized, clean, and carries a lot of products. The meat and seafood are always fresh. I'd like to get my yoghurt and oat milk here, of which they have many varieties and at reasonable prices.
I used to come daily  to their cafe for fresh made breakfast sandwiches and coffee before COVID. Today, I came again. And Marla  at the counter was very patient to customize my breakfast sandwich. Although it was busy, she still came to ask the customers how their breakfasts were. I highly recommend this store, especially their breakfast sandwiches and coffee.
